byline.contributor: Clair MacDougall contributed reporting from Monrovia, Liberia.

abstract: World Health Organization declares Liberia free of Ebola, making country first of three most ravaged by disease to bring formal end to epidemic; organization cautions that it is still very concerned about Guinea and Sierra Leone.
lead_paragraph: The announcement Saturday made Liberia the first of the hardest-hit West African countries, including Guinea and Sierra Leone, to bring a formal end to the epidemic.

headline.main: Liberia Is Declared Free of Ebola, but Officials Sound Note of Caution
headline.print_headline: Jubilant Liberia Is Declared Free of Ebola, but Officials Sound Note of Caution

snippet: The announcement Saturday made Liberia the first of the hardest-hit West African countries, including Guinea and Sierra Leone, to bring a formal end to the epidemic.
